conclusion: Understand how position and size of objects change when light source moves.
Objects labeled A, B, C, and D positioned above slabs.
Light source moves forward above the objects.
Objects change position relative to light source when it moves.
Size of objects changes due to perspective shift when light source moves.
Initial positions: A on left, B on right, C in front of A, D on right.
Objects shift closer to light source when it moves forward.
Objects' size increases as they move closer to light source.
Objects appear larger in image as light source moves forward.
Size increases proportionally to distance from light source.
Final position and size determined by relative positions and sizes to light source.
Objects move closer to light source, appearing larger in image.
